description:
The Spacer control helps you lay out children within a parent container. Although the Spacer control does not draw anything, it does allocate space for itself within its parent container.

In the following example, a flexible Spacer control is used to push the Button control to the right, so that the Button control is aligned with the right edge of the HBox container:

 <mx:HBox> <mx:Image source=\"Logo.jpg\"/> <mx:Label text=\"Company XYZ\"/> <mx:Spacer width=\"100%\"/> <mx:Button label=\"Close\"/> </mx:HBox>

The <mx:Spacer> tag inherits all of the tag attributes of its superclass, and adds no new tag attributes.

 <mx:Spacer/>
